content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm in **READ-ONLY mode** and cannot modify, create, or delete any files.

Let me start by getting oriented with the project structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && find . -type f -name "*.go" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.tsx" | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="read">
<parameter name="path">/Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I can see this is a personal agent project with:
- **Go backend** (`packages/go-backend/`) - handling agent logic, inference, and server
- **Desktop UI** (`packages/desktop/`) - Electron-based frontend with React/TypeScript
- **E2E tests** for the desktop application

The recent commits show:
- Core skills restoration from git history
- UI density improvements and backend provider management
- Python remnants removal
- Duplicate message filtering fixes
- New providers with unified interface

I'm warmed up and ready to explore the codebase thoroughly and design implementation plans based on your requirements. What would you like me to work on?
